header_summary: Dr Maxim Orlovsky plans to create a simplified paper explaining how their generic model, "Prometheus," can be applied to a specific case of two-way peg. Sergi Delgado Segura announces an upcoming Bitcoin Research Day at Chaincode in Midtown NYC on October 27th, 2023, which aims to bring together researchers and developers to discuss the robustness, security, and decentralization of Bitcoin. ZmnSCPxj discusses the need for `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` in a specific context and explores alternative approaches to ensure single-use. Vincenzo Palazzo presents the "Lightning Network Interoperability Initiative," aiming to provide common tools for integration tests and stress testing implementations to ensure protocol compliance and compatibility. ZmnSCPxj proposes the concept of sidepools to address liquidity allocation challenges on the Lightning Network, highlighting its benefits and implementation compatibility.

recent_posts.title: Trustless 2-way-peg without softfork
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender received feedback on their proposal to create a simpler paper explaining their generic model.
- They plan to work on this task over the next few weeks and share it with the mailing list.
- The feedback suggests focusing on applying the model to a specific case of two-way peg.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Research Day 2023
recent_posts.summary:
- The email announces the Bitcoin Research Day at Chaincode in Midtown NYC on October 27th, 2023.
- The event aims to bring together researchers and developers for discussions on Bitcoin.
- Lightning talk slots are available, and participants can RSVP through the website.

recent_posts.title: Actuarial System To Reduce Interactivity In N-of-N (N > 2) Multiparticipant Offchain Mechanisms
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses loose interactivity and the need for `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` in a specific context.
- The actuary can gather signatures for the next state while signing new transactions on top of it.
- `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` allows spending either the next state or the current state plus additional transactions.

recent_posts.title: Announcing the Lightning Network Interoperability Initiative
recent_posts.summary:
- Vincent has proposed the "Lightning Network Interoperability Initiative" for integration testing and stress testing.
- The initiative aims at creating language-agnostic tools for various types of integration tests.
- Vincent has made progress with lnprototest and invites feedback and collaboration from the community.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Research Day 2023
recent_posts.summary:
- The email announces the Bitcoin Research Day conference at Chaincode in Midtown NYC on October 27th, 2023.
- The event aims to discuss the robustness, security, and decentralization of the Bitcoin system.
- Notable speakers will give longer talks, and lightning talks are available for shorter presentations.

recent_posts.title: Sidepools For Improving Payment Reliability At Scale
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses difficulties in predicting liquidity allocation on the Lightning Network.
- Sidepools are proposed as a solution, allowing funds to be managed without closing channels.
- Sidepools help maintain liquidity, preserve privacy, and support scalability on the Lightning Network.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains involves fully 'blinded' servers.
- In this model, the statechain server reports the number of partial signatures generated.
- Parties generate private and public keys, and aggregate them to sign messages.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Based on several factors, storage for blockchain is sufficiently limited.
- Currently, a 500GB blockchain has significant growth potential, but affordable 5TB hard drives provide ample space for 21 years.
- Ongoing optimization efforts and decreasing hardware costs further ensure sufficient storage for practical usage.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The proposal includes a revised implementation and a new opcode called OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY (CCV).
- This new opcode, along with OP_CAT, allows for the full functionality of MATT.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a method to make lightning channels resumable with wallet seeds.
- It suggests a new type of channel funding transaction with additional spending paths.
- The proposal discusses fraud proofs, bandwidth saving, and alternative options without OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard is proposing to organize the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- The announcement is being made well in advance to address potential complexities.
- Antoine invites objections or feedback and emphasizes transparency and accountability in the project.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
- Bastien has submitted a pull request to document a concept for secure lightning node commands.
- The architecture utilizes a hardware security module as a whitelisted lightning peer.
- Bastien offers to provide specifications and review implementation, suggesting potential open-source grant funding.
